original.label: [strong][link: Georgette Heyer][/strong] (1902–74) was a British [link1: historical romance] and [link2: detective fiction] novelist. Her writing career began in 1921, when she turned a story for her younger brother into the novel [em][link3: The Black Moth][/em] [em](title page pictured)[/em]. After [em][link4: These Old Shades][/em] became popular despite its release during the [link5: General Strike], Heyer determined that publicity was not necessary for good sales and refused to give interviews thereafter. She essentially established the historical romance genre and its subgenre [link6: Regency romance]. To ensure accuracy, Heyer kept detailed notes on all aspects of Regency life. While some critics thought the novels were too detailed, others considered the detail to be her greatest asset. Beginning in 1932, Heyer released one romance novel and one [link7: thriller] each year. Her husband often provided basic plot outlines for the thrillers, leaving Heyer to develop character relationships and dialogue. Although many critics describe Heyer's detective novels as unoriginal, others praise them for their wit and plots. Her success was sometimes clouded by problems with tax inspectors and alleged plagiarists. Heyer continued writing until her death; her last book, [em][link8: My Lord John][/em], was published posthumously. ([link][strong: Full article...][/link])

translations.label: [strong]link:乔其纱海耶] [/strong] (1902–74) was a British link1:历史演义]和[link2:侦探小说]小说家。她的写作生涯始于1921年，当她把故事给她的弟弟到新的[em]link3:黑蛾] [/em] em](title page pictured)/em]. After em]link4:这些旧灯罩] [/em] became popular despite its release during the link5:总罢工]，海耶确定的宣传是没有必要的良好的销售，并拒绝接受采访之后。她基本上是建立在历史的浪漫风格和体裁[link6:摄政浪漫。为了确保准确性，海耶不断摄政生活的各个方面的详细说明。虽然一些批评家认为小说是太详细，别人认为细节是她最大的资产。 1932年开始，海耶发行了一张浪漫小说和一个[link7:惊悚片]每年。她的丈夫经常提供基本情节概述了惊悚片，留下海耶发展人物关系和对话。虽然许多批评者形容海耶的侦探小说作为喧宾夺主，别人称赞他们的智慧和阴谋。她的成功，有时问题与税务稽查人员和涉嫌抄袭而蒙上阴影。海耶继续写作，直到她去世;她的最后一本书，[em]link8:我的主约翰] [/em], was published posthumously. (link]strong:全文...] [/链接]）
